subject: Education
title: Grades: Motivator or Demotivator?
description: A fast breakdown of Grades: Motivator or Demotivator? for builders.

hook.text: A school replaced letter grades with detailed feedback. Student learning increased; anxiety dropped.

buildup.text: Grades are the most universal extrinsic motivator in educationâ€”and the most controversial.

discovery.text: Research shows grades motivate performance-avoidance: students aim to not fail, not to truly learn.

twist.text: When students receive grades AND feedback, they ignore the feedback and focus only on the grade.

climax.text: Feedback without grades produces the most learning; grades without feedback produce the least.

punchline.text: The grade says what you got. The comment says how to grow.

quiz.question: What happens when students receive both grades and feedback?
options: They tend to ignore the feedback and focus only on the grade
